page.title: 03WOODLAND
page.content: There are only 5 species of native trees and few individuals.This is because trees were cut for firewood when the island was well populated and the introduction of sheep and rabbits have prevented regeneration. Since 1881,40 different kinds of trees have been introduced, some of which have become established. Dr Campbell who has owned the island since 1938 has increased the amount of woodland with the develoment of several small plantations. This has benefited birds and increased the number of woodland species breeding on Canna. Another conservation measure instigated by Dr Campbell is a man made pool on Sanday with reeds and a small plantation of trees next to it.This has benefited birds, butterflies and moths.
